funFacts.title: Fun Facts
funFacts.description: Discover fascinating things about the world

facts.honey: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found 3,000-year-old honey that was still perfectly edible!
facts.octopus: An octopus has three hearts and blue blood.
facts.eiffel: The Eiffel Tower grows about 15 cm taller in summer due to the heat expanding the iron.
facts.bamboo: Bamboo can grow up to 91 cm in a single day — that's almost a metre!
facts.elephant: Elephants are the only animals that can't jump.
facts.venus: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
facts.bananas: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not!
facts.seahorse: Seahorse fathers carry and give birth to their babies.
facts.starfish: Starfish don't have brains or blood.
facts.giraffe: A giraffe's tongue is about 50 cm long and is dark purple.
facts.sunlight: Sunlight takes about 8 minutes to travel from the Sun to Earth.
facts.dolphins: Dolphins sleep with one eye open.
facts.moon: The Moon is slowly moving away from Earth — about 3.8 cm per year.
facts.koala: Koalas sleep for up to 22 hours a day.
facts.rainbows: It's possible to see a full circle rainbow from an aeroplane.
facts.chocolate: The word 'chocolate' comes from the Aztec word 'xocolatl'.
facts.hummingbird: A hummingbird's heart beats over 1,200 times per minute.
facts.waterEarth: About 71% of the Earth's surface is covered in water.
facts.penguins: Penguins propose to their mates with a pebble.
facts.trees: There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way galaxy.
facts.cows: Cows have best friends and get stressed when they're separated.
facts.tongue: Everyone's tongue print is different, just like fingerprints.
facts.greatWall: The Great Wall of China is over 21,000 km long.
facts.ants: Ants can carry objects 50 times their own body weight.
facts.flamingos: Flamingos are pink because of the shrimp they eat.
facts.saturn: Saturn would float if you could find a bathtub big enough.
facts.strawberry: A strawberry isn't actually a berry — it's an 'accessory fruit'.
facts.owls: A group of owls is called a 'parliament'.
facts.lightning: Lightning strikes the Earth about 100 times every second.

animalFriends.title: Animal Friends
animalFriends.description: Meet animals and learn fun facts

facts.elephant: Elephants can recognise themselves in a mirror — only a few animals can do this!
facts.dolphin: Dolphins give each other names and call out to each other.
facts.owl: Owls can turn their heads almost all the way around — up to 270 degrees!
facts.penguin: Penguins are excellent swimmers and can hold their breath for 20 minutes.
facts.cat: Cats spend about 70% of their lives sleeping. What a life!
facts.dog: Dogs can understand up to 250 words and can count to five.
facts.butterfly: Monarch butterflies travel thousands of miles during migration.
facts.horse: Horses can sleep both lying down and standing up.
facts.rabbit: Rabbits can see almost 360 degrees around them without turning their heads.
facts.bee: A single bee can visit up to 5,000 flowers in a single day.
facts.turtle: Sea turtles can live to be over 100 years old.
facts.parrot: Some parrots can live to be 80 years old and learn hundreds of words.
facts.cow: Cows have best friends and get stressed when they're apart.
facts.koala: Koalas sleep for up to 22 hours a day and eat eucalyptus leaves.
facts.flamingo: Flamingos can only eat with their heads upside down.
facts.octopus: An octopus has three hearts and blue blood.
facts.giraffe: A giraffe's tongue is about 50 cm long and is dark purple to prevent sunburn.
facts.hedgehog: Hedgehogs have about 5,000 to 7,000 spines on their backs.
facts.sheep: Sheep can recognise up to 50 other sheep by their faces.
facts.goldfish: Goldfish can remember things for months — not just 3 seconds!

kindFarmer.title: The Kind Farmer
kindFarmer.p1: Once upon a time, there was a kind farmer named Thomas who lived on a small farm at the edge of a village. Every morning, he would walk through his fields, talking to his animals as if they were old friends.
kindFarmer.p2: One cold winter morning, Thomas found a lost baby lamb shivering by his gate. He wrapped it in his warmest blanket and carried it inside by the fire. He fed it warm milk and sang it a gentle song.
kindFarmer.p3: By spring, the little lamb had grown strong and healthy. It would follow Thomas everywhere, and the villagers would smile and wave. Thomas always said, 'A little kindness goes a long way.'
kindFarmer.discussion: What did you think of Thomas? Have you ever helped an animal?

lostKitten.title: The Lost Kitten
lostKitten.p1: A little ginger kitten named Marmalade had wandered too far from home. She found herself in a big garden she didn't recognise, with tall flowers towering above her.
lostKitten.p2: She mewed softly, and a friendly robin landed nearby. 'Follow me!' chirped the robin, hopping along the garden path. Marmalade followed, her tiny paws padding on the warm stones.
lostKitten.p3: Soon, she could hear a familiar voice calling her name. It was her owner, Mrs. Henderson, standing at the garden gate with a saucer of cream. Marmalade ran to her, purring with happiness.
lostKitten.discussion: Have you ever had a cat? What was your favourite pet?

magicGarden.title: The Magic Garden
magicGarden.p1: In a quiet corner of the village, there was a garden that seemed to have a magic of its own. Flowers bloomed in every colour, and butterflies danced from blossom to blossom.
magicGarden.p2: Old Mrs. Willoughby tended the garden with love and care. She knew every plant by name and would tell visitors stories about each one. 'This rose was planted the year my daughter was born,' she would say.
magicGarden.p3: People came from far and wide to visit the garden. They would sit on the old wooden bench, close their eyes, and breathe in the sweet perfume. Everyone left feeling a little happier.
magicGarden.discussion: Do you enjoy gardens? What is your favourite flower?

rainbowBridge.title: The Rainbow Bridge
rainbowBridge.p1: After a great rainstorm, a magnificent rainbow appeared over the village. Little Emma pointed and said, 'I want to find where it ends!'
rainbowBridge.p2: She walked through meadows of wildflowers, past the old mill, and along the brook. At every turn, the rainbow seemed just a little further away, but each step brought a new wonder.
rainbowBridge.p3: When she finally sat down under an old oak tree, she realised the real treasure wasn't at the end of the rainbow — it was the beautiful journey she had taken to get there.
rainbowBridge.discussion: What is the most beautiful thing you've seen in nature?

oldLighthouse.title: The Old Lighthouse
oldLighthouse.p1: On a rocky cliff overlooking the sea stood an old lighthouse. Its keeper, Mr. Arthur, had tended its light for forty years, guiding ships safely through stormy nights.
oldLighthouse.p2: Every evening, he would climb the spiral stairs, light the great lamp, and watch its beam sweep across the dark water. 'Someone out there needs this light tonight,' he would whisper.
oldLighthouse.p3: When it was time for him to retire, the whole village threw him a celebration. A ship's captain stood and said, 'You saved my life once, Mr. Arthur. Your light brought me home.'
oldLighthouse.discussion: Have you ever been to a lighthouse? What is your favourite seaside memory?

winterRobin.title: The Winter Robin
winterRobin.p1: On a frosty December morning, a little robin with a bright red breast landed on Margaret's windowsill. She scattered some breadcrumbs, and the robin hopped closer.
winterRobin.p2: Every morning that winter, the robin returned. Margaret would sit by the window with her cup of tea, and the robin would sing its cheerful song. They became the best of friends.
winterRobin.p3: When spring arrived, the robin built a nest in Margaret's garden hedge. Soon, tiny chirps could be heard — baby robins! Margaret smiled, knowing her garden was full of new life.
winterRobin.discussion: Do you enjoy watching birds? What birds visit your garden?

bakersSecret.title: The Baker's Secret
bakersSecret.p1: In the heart of the village, Mr. Bridges ran a little bakery. Every morning, the most wonderful smell of fresh bread drifted down the street, making everyone smile.
bakersSecret.p2: People often asked him the secret to his delicious bread. He would wink and say, 'I add a pinch of happiness to every loaf!' Nobody knew if he was joking or not.
bakersSecret.p3: One day, a little boy peeked into the kitchen and saw Mr. Bridges singing and dancing as he kneaded the dough. The boy giggled and said, 'I found the secret — it's joy!'
bakersSecret.discussion: What is your favourite thing from a bakery? Do you enjoy baking?

dancingLeaves.title: The Dancing Leaves
dancingLeaves.p1: In autumn, the old park became a painting of gold, red, and orange. The leaves would swirl and dance in the breeze, as if performing a ballet just for the people below.
dancingLeaves.p2: Grandfather and little Sophie walked through the park every Saturday. Sophie would try to catch the falling leaves, while Grandfather told her that each leaf carried a wish.
dancingLeaves.p3: Sophie caught a beautiful golden leaf and made a wish. 'What did you wish for?' asked Grandfather. 'That we can walk here together forever,' she said, holding his hand tightly.
dancingLeaves.discussion: What is your favourite memory of autumn? Do you enjoy walks?

friendlyPostman.title: The Friendly Postman
friendlyPostman.p1: Everyone in the village knew Mr. Charlie the postman. Rain or shine, he delivered the post with a smile and always had time for a chat. His red bicycle was a cheerful sight on the lanes.
friendlyPostman.p2: One day, he noticed that old Mrs. Jenkins hadn't collected her post in three days. Worried, he knocked on her door. She had caught a cold and couldn't get out of bed.
friendlyPostman.p3: Mr. Charlie made her a cup of tea and called her daughter. From that day on, everyone agreed that Mr. Charlie didn't just deliver letters — he delivered kindness too.
friendlyPostman.discussion: Do you remember a kind neighbour? What was your community like?

sunflowerField.title: The Sunflower Field
sunflowerField.p1: Behind the schoolhouse, there was a field of sunflowers that stretched as far as the eye could see. Each summer, they would turn their golden faces towards the sun.
sunflowerField.p2: The children loved to play hide-and-seek among the tall sunflowers. Teacher Mrs. Rose would tell them, 'Be like the sunflowers — always look towards the light!'
sunflowerField.p3: Years later, those children — now grandparents themselves — still smiled when they saw sunflowers. They remembered the golden field and Mrs. Rose's wise words.
sunflowerField.discussion: Do you like sunflowers? What is your favourite memory of summer?
